To Atheists: Are you smart enough to be an atheist? 

Frankly, this sounds like an attempted insult, and quite arrogant too. If that was not your intention, I would suggest rephrasing it. To answer it though, yes, I would say so. It doesn't necessarily require being smarter than others to be atheist, but as I am not accepting unproven and unsupported claims concerning the existence of a god then I would say I am definitely more logical, at least in this area.

How would you respond to [1] this video by John Safran?

I'll try and break it down.

People smart enough to understand science...

I don't understand everything in science, atheism requires no such thing. All it requires is that you not accept some very specific claims, or whatever reason.

You're a humanities student with an arts degree...

This doesn't apply to me. I'm a mechanical engineer.

If I come over to your house right now...

That[.] creepy...

why the big bang theory is more rational than genesis...

Again, atheism doesn't require that knowledge, nor does the big bang theory necessarily relate to atheism in any way. I probably could work my way through a reasonably acceptable explanation though, at least for the occasion.

Bought a copy of Stephen Hawking[.] Brief History of Time...

I haven't purchased on personally, but my Dad did way back when...

... on page three...

... and I did finish it.

Until next time, go to hell...

Isn't that nice.
